welcome.title: JARDIM DA AMAZÔNIA
welcome.subtitle: A CRYSTAL WATER OASIS IN THE SOUTHERN AMAZON

about.description: Located on the banks of the Rio Claro, Jardim da Amazônia is a refuge that unites the Amazon Rainforest and the Cerrado, offering one of Brazil's richest and most diverse ecosystems. Our goal is to provide an authentic experience of connection with nature, in a peaceful and preserved environment, while caring for the natural legacy for future generations.

biodiversity.quote: An ecological corridor formed by an ecotone, where Cerrado and Amazon meet, creating a true refuge for biodiversity, with:
biodiversity.author: Raquel Zanchet

experiences.title: Experiences
experiences.subtitle: Explore, discover, and be enchanted by wildlife in its natural habitat.

birdwatching.title: Birdwatching
birdwatching.description: Discover over 590 bird species cataloged in our reserve, including rare and endemic species.

primates.title: Primate Observation
primates.description: Find 7 of the 29 primate species recognized in Mato Grosso in their natural habitat.

safari.title: Safari Boat
safari.description: Navigate the Rio Claro and observe wildlife in an unforgettable journey.

location.title: Where We Are
location.description: Jardim da Amazônia is located in São José do Rio Claro, Mato Grosso, in an ecological transition area between the Amazon Rainforest and the Brazilian Cerrado.

address.title: Address
address.text: São José do Rio Claro - MT

testimonials.title: Reviews
testimonials.platformsTitle: See more reviews on our networks:

items.quote: A unique and unforgettable experience. Nature in its purest state, with comfortable accommodations and an extremely attentive staff.
items.author: Maria Silva

items.quote: Amazing place for birdwatching! We managed to record over 100 species in just 3 days.
items.author: João Santos

items.quote: The trails are very well maintained and the guides are extremely knowledgeable. A true immersion in nature.
items.author: Ana Costa

cta.title: Come Live This Experience
cta.subtitle: Book your stay and prepare for unforgettable moments in nature.

hero.title: Accommodations
hero.subtitle: Comfort and nature in perfect harmony

intro.description: Our bungalows and apartments have been carefully designed to provide maximum comfort during your stay while maintaining a harmonious connection with nature. Each accommodation offers a unique experience for your stay.

familyBungalow.name: Family Bungalow
familyBungalow.description: Enjoy the view of Rio Claro and lagoons in comfortable bungalows, featuring a king-size bed, single beds for up to 4 people, cotton sheets, eco-friendly amenities, and hammocks on the veranda to relax after jungle adventures.

gardenBungalow.name: Garden Bungalow
gardenBungalow.description: Charming bungalow for up to 2 people, perfect for couples. Relax on the private veranda with hammocks, surrounded by the tranquility of nature.

farmhouse.name: Farmhouse
farmhouse.description: The historic Farmhouse, built in 1986, offers apartments that combine the charm of period furniture with modern comfort.

forestHouse.name: Forest House
forestHouse.description: A retrofitted house near the forest where hummingbirds can be spotted. This special house offers an immersive experience among the trees, connecting you to local biodiversity with all comfort.

designQuote.text: Cozy Lodge facilities inspired by the stilt houses and wooden structures of the 1980s Amazon, celebrating the harmony between man and nature. The decor adopts earthy and neutral tones, with a palette that evokes the natural environment: browns, beiges, and moss greens create a rustic-chic style where simplicity brings a welcoming atmosphere perfectly integrated into the Amazonian landscape.
designQuote.author: Alê Ribeiro

cta.title: Ready to Live this Experience?
cta.subtitle: Book your stay now and prepare for unforgettable moments in nature

hero.title: External Areas
hero.subtitle: Outdoor spaces for your connection with nature

intro.quote: The pioneering work at Jardim da Amazônia resulted in the preservation of a large untouched area of primary Amazon rainforest. Nature devotees, the Zanchet family invested in birdwatching activities in 1997, making this place an important ecological sanctuary.
intro.author: Alex Robinson

naturalPool.title: Natural Pool
naturalPool.description: Our natural pool is fed by a crystal-clear spring, providing a refreshing dip in nature. With a wooden deck and loungers, it's the perfect place to relax.

trails.title: Trails
trails.description: Explore our ecological trails, carefully maintained to provide a safe and enriching experience in the Amazon rainforest.

communalArea.title: Communal Area
communalArea.description: Cozy space for moments of relaxation, reading, or simply appreciating nature. Equipped with hammocks, sofas, and tables, it's ideal for socializing.

birdwatching.title: Birdwatching
birdwatching.description: Explore the rich diversity of Amazonian birds around our property

recreation.title: Recreation Area
recreation.description: Children have their guaranteed space for fun in our mini sand court and charming doll house

photography.title: Photography
photography.description: Capture special moments in stunning natural settings

meditation.title: Meditation
meditation.description: Find peace and tranquility in every corner of our space.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: Our external areas were developed using local materials and techniques that minimize environmental impact, ensuring the preservation of the natural ecosystem.

cta.title: Come Visit Our Spaces
cta.description: Book your stay and enjoy all these unique experiences

intro.description1: Family recipes, traditionally prepared by Carmelita, have been given a new twist with the arrival of Chef José Sérgio. Dishes based on local fish, such as matrinxã and pintado, are combined with classic kabocha squash, grilled vegetables, and plantain farofa.
intro.description2: Fried polenta and sago dessert bring the Zanchet family's Italian roots to the table, in a combination of tradition and creativity. At breakfast, the aroma of café au lait mingles with the comfort of scrambled eggs, homemade cakes, and other delights that comfort both palate and heart.

desserts.title: Delicious Desserts
desserts.subtitle: Classic sweets that delight both palate and eyes

chefStatement.title: From Farm to Table
chefStatement.quote1: Gastronomy has always aimed to unite people, whether through cooking or raw ingredients. The true purpose is to feed the 'soul' before feeding the body. This quest for the pleasure of nourishing and providing meaningful moments has been constant since our ancestry. Today, this quest continues with countless products and producers. Thus was born the 'FARM TO TABLE' concept, which means bringing what comes from the earth to the table. This journey led me to an immersion in the Ecotone, between the Amazon and Cerrado, where I found an incredible place called Jardim da Amazônia, with a home kitchen led by a lady named CARMELITA ZANCHET.
chefStatement.quote2: On this journey, I discovered that simplicity is essential for the eyes and soul. Fruits, seeds, vegetables, fish, and other delicacies I found in this Amazon/Cerrado fusion are undoubtedly the pursuit of my life project as a cook. I found a safe harbor, or 'safe kitchen'. Where will this journey take me? I'm still discovering, in no hurry to reach the end! Cooking is, above all, a great act of LOVE.
chefStatement.author: Chef José Sérgio

localIngredients.title: Local Ingredients
localIngredients.description: We value local producers, ensuring fresh ingredients and contributing to strengthening the region's economy.

hero.title: Birdwatching
hero.subtitle: Top Hotspot for Bird Observation in Brazil

intro.description: Jardim da Amazônia is a world reference in bird protection, as it is considered an IBA (Important Bird Area), an important area for Biodiversity according to Birdlife International, E-bird, The Cornell Lab, and Wikiaves.

tieBicudo.name: Cone-billed Tanager
tieBicudo.description: A bird endemic to Brazil, described in 1939 during Claude Levi Strauss's expedition. Rio Claro represents the fourth known area of occurrence for this rare species.

curica.name: Orange-cheeked Parrot
curica.description: Parrot with black head, white eye patch, and orange cheeks. Spectacular colorful wing patches contrast with the green body.

umbrellaBird.name: Amazonian Umbrellabird
umbrellaBird.description: Impressive bird with an umbrella-shaped crest and gular sac. The male displays its inflated sac, emitting deep, resonant sounds.

biodiversity.title: Biodiversity
biodiversity.description: In a unique setting where the Cerrado meets the Amazon, our lodge offers the rare opportunity to experience the interaction of two of the planet's richest biodiversities.

itinerary.title: Itinerary
items: Bird observation at Rio Claro and Lakes
Stop at 'Cabin Trail' for forest species
Possibility to observe the Black-faced Spider Monkey
Return for lunch at the lodge

rioClaroRiparian.title: Rio Claro Riparian Forest
rioClaroRiparian.description: Habitat of the rare Cone-billed Tanager and various Amazonian species. The open vegetation along the lakes provides essential conditions for observation.

jatoba.title: Jatoba Trail
jatoba.description: Privileged location for observing the Gould's Toucanet and other forest species.

tieBicudoLagoon.title: Cone-billed Tanager Lagoon
tieBicudoLagoon.description: Special boat tour for observing the Cone-billed Tanager and other aquatic species.

references.title: International References
references.description: Stay up to date with Jardim da Amazônia's birdwatching news on the main birdwatching websites:

hero.title: Primates
hero.subtitle: Meet the primates of Jardim da Amazônia

intro.title: Our Primates
intro.description1: Jardim da Amazônia, located in São José do Rio Claro, in the Chapadão dos Parecis, is a convergence point between the Cerrado and the Amazon Forest, standing out as the birthplace of numerous springs and exceptional biodiversity.
intro.description2: This environment is home to more than 30 species of medium and large mammals, including 07 primate species, some of which are critically endangered and endemic to northern MT.

zoguezogue.name: Mato Grosso Titi Monkey
zoguezogue.description: Critically endangered primate, endemic to northern Mato Grosso, found between the Teles Pires and Arinos rivers. One of the 25 most endangered primate species on the planet.

parauacu.name: Tapajo's Saki Monkey
parauacu.description: Vulnerable species that acts as a forest gardener, dispersing seeds of various sizes and hardness. Currently the subject of doctoral research focused on its distribution and conservation.

macacoaranha.name: Black-faced Spider Monkey
macacoaranha.description: The largest frugivorous primate in the region, classified as Vulnerable in Brazil and Endangered globally. Inhabits tall, rainy forests, both flooded and terra firme.

bestTime.title: Best Time
bestTime.description: Southern Amazon has a hot and humid climate.

ideal.description: Dry season with transparent waters and white sand beaches

macaquear.title: Macaquear in Mato Grosso
macaquear.description1: Brazil is the country with the highest primate diversity in the world. Mato Grosso is home to 29 species distributed among Pantanal, Cerrado, and Amazon, making it equivalent to the 13th country in primate diversity.
macaquear.description2: 'Macaquear' is an initiative by Instituto Ecótono in partnership with the Brazilian Primatology Society, which encourages responsible primate observation as a tool for conservation and local development.

route.title: Mato Grosso Primate Route
route.intro: Brazil is the country with the highest number of primate species in the world, and if Mato Grosso were a country, it would be among the top ten. This richness is due to the variety of biomes and large rivers that act as geographical barriers.

about.title: About the Route
about.description: Since 2023, Instituto Ecótono in partnership with Jardim da Amazônia and Cristalino Lodge have developed a route that allows observing 14 species in seven locations, in a 15-day itinerary.

destinations.title: Destinations
destinations.places: São José do Rio Claro • Sinop • Alta Floresta

benefits.title: Benefits
benefits.items: Citizen science • Academic research • Sustainable tourism • Local income

route.note: All involved follow wildlife observation best practices, contributing to forest conservation.

hero.title: Safari Boat
hero.subtitle: Explore the wildlife of the Amazonian rivers

intro.description1: The Safari Boat is a unique experience that allows you to explore the rich biodiversity of the Amazonian rivers. During the tour, you'll have the opportunity to observe various species of fish, birds, and reptiles in their natural habitat.
intro.description2: Our specialized guides share their knowledge about the local fauna, providing an educational and exciting experience.

kingfisher.title: Kingfisher
kingfisher.description: A fishing bird that enchants with its vibrant colors and precise fishing technique.

caiman.title: Dwarf Caiman
caiman.description: A caiman species typical of the Southern Amazon, smaller than its relatives. Can be spotted on riverbanks and in flooded areas during the safari.

tapir.title: Tapir
tapir.description: The largest land mammal in South America, frequently spotted on riverbanks during the Safari Boat. An important seed disperser, contributing to forest regeneration.

hero.title: Field Guides
hero.subtitle: Discover the biodiversity of Jardim da Amazônia

speciesList.title: Species Lists
speciesList.description: Our region is home to extraordinary biodiversity, documented through years of scientific research. Here you'll find guides and publications about our fauna and flora.

birds.title: Birds of Jardim da Amazônia
birds.description: Catalog of bird species observed in the region. Content under development.

mammals.title: Mammals of Jardim da Amazônia
mammals.description: List of mammals recorded in the Jardim da Amazônia area.

research.title: Research Support
research.description: Jardim da Amazônia actively supports scientific research in our region. If you are a researcher interested in developing studies in our area, please contact us.

climate.title: Climate
climate.description: Our region has a typical Amazonian climate with well-defined seasons. Understanding climate conditions is essential for planning wildlife and flora observation activities.

hero.title: Ecological Trails
hero.subtitle: Explore the biodiversity of the Amazon

jatoba.title: Jatoba Trail
jatoba.description: Trail that leads to a century-old Jatoba tree (Hymenaea courbaril), over 40 meters tall.

lagoa.title: Macaw Lagoon
lagoa.description: Walk to a natural lagoon where you can observe macaws and other birds.

laboratorio.title: Laboratory Trail
laboratorio.description: Route that passes through scientific research points and wildlife observation areas.

arinos.title: Arinos River
arinos.description: Trail that follows the Arinos River, ideal for bird and primate observation.

piquia.title: Pequiá Trail
piquia.description: Walk through a transition area between Cerrado and Amazon.

angelim.title: Angelim Trail
angelim.description: Route that leads to a majestic Angelim tree, typical of the region.

hero.title: Jardim da Amazônia Research Station
hero.subtitle: Center of Excellence in Research and Conservation in the Amazon-Cerrado Transition

intro.description: We are a space dedicated to expanding global scientific knowledge about biodiversity in the Amazon-Cerrado transition. Our mission is to provide the necessary infrastructure and support for researchers from around the world to study and document the rich biodiversity of this region, so they can contribute to the understanding and preservation of life on our planet.

infrastructure.title: Infrastructure and Logistics
infrastructure.description: We offer comfortable accommodation, quality meals, and experienced guides who deeply know the region. Our structure includes well-maintained trails and strategic observation points, allowing researchers from different nationalities to conduct their studies safely and efficiently.

database.title: Collaborative Database
database.description: We maintain a digital collection with sighting records, photographs, and data collected by researchers who visit our station. This database aims to contribute to the advancement of scientific knowledge and understanding of tropical ecosystems.

species.title: Species of Interest
species.description: Our region is home to unique species that are fundamental to understanding global biodiversity. Over the years, researchers from various countries have documented and studied these species, contributing to worldwide scientific knowledge and conservation strategies that benefit the entire planet.

spiderMonkey.name: Black-faced Spider Monkey
spiderMonkey.description: Endangered species that acts as a seed disperser

sakiMonkey.name: Tapajós Saki
sakiMonkey.description: Endemic species to the region with reduced population

angelim.name: Angelim Tree
angelim.description: Emergent tree vital for local fauna

buriti.name: Buriti Palm
buriti.description: Palm tree indicator of wetland areas

contact.title: Come Research With Us
contact.description: If you are a researcher interested in developing studies in our area, please contact us. We are ready to support your research and contribute to the advancement of global scientific knowledge.

hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.subtitle: Everything you need to know about your stay

roomTypes.question: What types of rooms are available?
roomTypes.answer:
We offer the following accommodation options:
- Bungalow
- Triple Room
- Double Room

roomAmenities.question: What's included in the room?
roomAmenities.answer: Our rooms are equipped with essential items for your comfort, including comfortable King-size bed, private bathroom, air conditioning, and Wi-Fi.

languages.question: Do you have guides who speak other languages?
languages.answer: Yes, we have guides who speak Portuguese, English, and Spanish. Please request when booking.

specializedGuides.question: Are there specialized guides for birdwatching?
specializedGuides.answer: Yes, we have specialized guides for birdwatching and primate observation activities. They are highly trained professionals with extensive experience in the region.

clothing.question: What type of clothing should I bring?
clothing.answer:
We recommend:
- Light, comfortable clothing
- Long pants and long-sleeve shirts for trails
- Comfortable walking shoes
- Swimming attire
- Hat or cap
- Rain jacket (during rainy season)

equipment.question: What equipment should I bring?
equipment.answer:
Essential items:
- Insect repellent
- Sunscreen
- Binoculars (for wildlife observation)
- Camera
- Water bottle

bestTime.question: What is the best time for birdwatching?
bestTime.answer: The best times are early morning (5:30-9:00) and late afternoon (15:30-18:00). Different species can be observed during different seasons.

species.question: How many bird species can be seen?
species.answer: Over 590 species have been cataloged in our area. The number of species you can observe varies depending on the season and length of stay.

types.question: What types of tours do you offer?
types.answer:
We offer various tours:
- Birdwatching
- Primate observation
- Nature trails
- Safari boat
- Night walks
- Photography tours

duration.question: How long are the tours?
duration.answer: Tour duration varies from 2 to 6 hours, depending on the activity. We can customize the schedule according to your interests and physical condition.

allowed.question: Are pets allowed?
allowed.answer: For the safety of our local wildlife and the comfort of all guests, we do not allow pets in our facilities.

howTo.question: How can I make a reservation?
howTo.answer:
You can make reservations through:
- Our website
- Email: reservas@jardimamazonia.com
- WhatsApp: +55 65 4042-0595

cancellation.question: What is your cancellation policy?
cancellation.answer: Cancellations must be made at least 30 days before check-in for full refund. Please contact us for detailed cancellation terms.

access.question: How do I get there?
access.answer:
We are located in São José do Rio Claro, MT. You can reach us by:
- Car from Cuiabá (4-hour drive)
- Transfer service from Cuiabá or Sinop airports

distance.question: How far is it from major cities?
distance.answer:
Distances:
- 330 km from Cuiabá
- 180 km from Sinop

internet.question: Is there internet access?
internet.answer: Yes, we offer high-speed internet via Starlink in common areas and accommodations.

activities.question: What leisure activities are available?
activities.answer:
We offer:
- Natural pool
- Nature trails
- Bird and wildlife observation
- Reading areas
- Relaxation spaces
- Outdoor social areas

meals.question: Are lunch and dinner options available on site?
meals.answer:
Yes, we offer meals in our restaurant. Schedule:
- Lunch: 12:30
- Dinner: 19:30

drinks.question: Can I bring my own drinks?
drinks.answer:
Outside beverages are not permitted.
Please request our Wine List.

times.question: What are the check-in and check-out times?

earlyArrival.question: Can I arrive before check-in time?
earlyArrival.answer: Yes, you can arrive and enjoy our environment. If you wish to have meals before your reservation time, there will be a fee of R$200 per person for all-you-can-eat buffet access.

availability.question: Do you offer Day Use?
availability.answer:
Yes, we accept advance reservations subject to availability.
Please consult with our sales team or via WhatsApp.

methods.question: What payment methods do you accept?
methods.answer: We accept credit cards, debit cards, and bank transfers.

wedding.question: Is it possible to take wedding photos at the location?
wedding.answer: Yes, we offer specific packages for photo sessions. Contact us for more details.

hero.title: How to Get Here
hero.subtitle: Discover the path to your nature retreat

intro.description: Jardim da Amazônia is located in São José do Rio Claro, Mato Grosso, 320 km from Cuiabá. Our privileged location places us at the heart of the transition between the Amazon and Cerrado, offering a unique biodiversity experience.

cuiaba.title: Via Cuiabá / CGB Airport
cuiaba.distance: Distance: 290 KM from Cuiabá International Airport

instructions.title: Instructions
steps: Follow Helder Cândia Highway (MT-010), known as 'Estrada a Guia'
Continue until Gil gas station at the top of the Serra
Turn right before the overpass towards Diamantino
Continue through new Diamantino towards São José do Rio Claro

sinop.title: Via Sinop - Nova Mutum / NOP Airport

instructions.title: Instructions
steps: On BR 163, in Nova Mutum, locate Águia Branca gas station
Turn right onto MT235 highway towards São José do Rio Claro
Drive 48 km until the junction with MT 010 (Fazenda Libra)
Turn right towards São José do Rio Claro
Before Rio Claro Bridge, turn left
Continue for 4 km on dirt road

importantNote.title: Important Note
importantNote.text: For the alternative route at km 644 (near two large antennas at São Genaro gas station) to São José do Rio Claro, please request detailed information.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Need help getting here? Our team is ready to assist you.

recommendations.title: Recommendations
items: Make the journey during daylight hours for better road visibility
Keep your fuel tank above half full
Download the offline Google Maps for the region. See you soon!

hero.title: Nature Events
hero.subtitle: Discover different ways to enjoy our space, whether for work, connection, or celebration, always in harmony with nature

photoSessions.title: Photo Sessions
features: Sessions for expectant mothers, engaged couples, and celebrations
photoSessions.quote: Eternalize your special moments in unique settings, with all comfort and warmth

weddingNight.title: Wedding Night
weddingNight.quote: Begin your love story in a magical and welcoming setting

gatherings.title: Gatherings
gatherings.quote: Moments of joy and relaxation in a welcoming environment

artisticResidencies.title: Artistic Residencies
artisticResidencies.quote: A refuge for artists to find inspiration and develop their projects

cta.title: Make Your Dream Come True With Us
cta.description: Our team is ready to help you create memorable experiences

hero.title: Media Press
hero.subtitle: What they say about Jardim da Amazônia

news.title: Jardim da Amazônia: Highlight in Scientific and Ecological Tourism
news.description: The lodge is recognized as one of the main points of the Mato Grosso Primate Route, standing out in conservation and scientific research.
news.fullContent:
Jardim da Amazônia was featured again in recent publications, reinforcing its role as one of Mato Grosso's most fascinating destinations for scientific and ecological tourism.

Mato Grosso Primate Route: Jardim da Amazônia was mentioned as one of the seven main locations of this conservation initiative, led by Instituto Ecótono in partnership with universities and research centers. Located about four hours from Cuiabá, Jardim da Amazônia stands out for its rich biodiversity, including species such as the black-faced spider monkey and the saki monkey. Visitors have the unique opportunity to observe at least 14 primate species along the route.

Saki Monkey Conservation: With ongoing doctoral studies, Jardim da Amazônia reinforces its mission to protect local fauna, playing a crucial role in seed dispersal and ecological preservation.

Tourism Fairs and Scientific Outreach: The Garden also participated in important events, such as WTM Latin America and ITB Berlin, promoting sustainable and educational tourism.

These recognitions reinforce Jardim da Amazônia's commitment to sustainability, research, and positive impact tourism.

news.title: Amazon: The new refuge for nature lovers and rare biodiversity
news.description: Internationally recognized as one of the three best destinations for bird and rare species observation, the lodge offers a unique experience for biodiversity enthusiasts.
news.fullContent:
In recent years, ecological tourism has gained momentum in Brazil, with the Amazon standing out as one of the most sought-after destinations for travelers seeking connection with nature. Jardim da Amazônia Lodge, located in the heart of the rainforest, is internationally recognized as one of the three best destinations for bird and rare species observation. With a sustainable structure and practices focused on environmental preservation, the lodge offers a unique experience, allowing visitors to closely observe endangered species such as the hyacinth macaw, the bare-faced curassow, and the harpy eagle.

For Raquel Zanchet, director of Jardim da Amazônia Lodge, ecological tourism is more than a trend: it's an essential tool for environmental awareness and conservation. 'Our goal is to provide a transformative experience for visitors while actively contributing to the preservation of Amazonian biodiversity,' she states. Guided tours by specialists allow exploring the region's rich biodiversity, promoting a deeper understanding of the challenges and importance of protecting this vital ecosystem.

news.title: Wanderlust Magazine highlights Jardim da Amazônia
news.description: In the December/January edition, Jardim da Amazônia is highlighted as a must-visit experience in the heart of Brazil, where the Pantanal meets the Amazon.
news.fullContent:
In the December/January issue of Wanderlust magazine, Jardim da Amazônia was highlighted as a must-visit experience in the heart of Brazil. Described as a place where 'the Pantanal meets the Amazon,' the article emphasized the uniqueness of our location and the abundance of wildlife around. They recommended Jardim da Amazônia as an ideal base for exploring the region's rich biodiversity and stunning landscapes, especially during the dry season when animals are more easily spotted.

The article also emphasized the charm of our hospitality and the opportunity for deep connection with nature, providing an authentic and memorable experience for those seeking to venture into the wild beauty of the Pantanal.

news.title: Brazilian Primates: Piauí, Maranhão, Pará and Matto Grosso
news.description: Lodge is highlighted as a strategic point for primate observation in the Amazon region.
news.fullContent:
Jardim da Amazônia shone again in a report about the 'Mato Grosso Primate Observation Route,' an innovative initiative created by experts like Russ Mittermeier and Gustavo Canale. The project focuses on the conservation and observation of 16 primate species in the region, of which 10 are endangered. During their visit to the Garden, travelers were enchanted by the rich diversity of species spotted, such as Mittermeier's white-faced sakis, black spider monkeys, and Azara's capuchin monkeys, as well as other animals like capybaras and anteaters.

The lodge's infrastructure, led by the Zanchet family, was highlighted for its impeccable hospitality, refined gastronomy, and commitment to environmental preservation, including the creation of tree corridors for local fauna. One of the highlights of the report was the flooded forest area near the natural pool, where saki families often feed, providing fascinating encounters for visitors. This project reaffirms Jardim da Amazônia as an essential destination for those seeking sustainable tourism and unique scientific experiences.

news.title: Monkey watching: primate observation practice has growth potential in Brazil
news.description: Jardim da Amazônia is cited as a reference in primate observation programs in Mato Grosso.
news.fullContent:
'Monkey watching is the act of observing primates, that is, monkeys, marmosets, tamarins, in their natural habitat. The great value of monkey watching is observing free monkeys in nature, performing natural behaviors, with minimal human intervention,' explains Gustavo Canale, vice-president of the Brazilian Primatology Society.

According to Canale, the name 'monkey watching' was inspired by another common practice worldwide, bird watching. 'In Brazil, bird watching has offered a great opportunity to observe monkeys too, because many bird watchers, when aiming their binoculars at the treetops, end up spotting capuchin monkeys, howler monkeys, spider monkeys, marmosets. For example, some of the best places to observe birds in the Amazon of Mato Grosso, Jardim da Amazônia and Cristalino Lodge, have already started organizing monkey watching programs in their tourist itineraries,' he says.

news.title: Cerrado-Amazon Ecotone on + Natureza
news.description: The + Natureza program highlights Jardim da Amazônia in a special episode about the meeting of Cerrado and Amazon.
news.fullContent:
The + Natureza program, aired on October 21, 2023, dedicated a special episode to the Cerrado-Amazon Ecotone region, where Jardim da Amazônia Lodge is located. With a duration of 26 minutes, the program explored the unique characteristics of this transition zone between two of Brazil's most important biomes.

The episode is available exclusively for Globoplay subscribers and presents the richness of local biodiversity, highlighting how the meeting of these two biomes creates a unique environment for observing fauna and flora.

During the program, different species that can be found in the region were presented, as well as the conservation and research work carried out at the lodge, reinforcing its role as an important support point for scientific studies and observation tourism.

hero.title: Photo Gallery
hero.subtitle: Explore our collection of images from Jardim da Amazônia

intro.title: Discover the Purity of Our Spring
intro.description: At the heart of Jardim da Amazonia, we find a natural spring that plays a fundamental role in preserving our ecosystem and enhancing our guests' experience. This spring, a source of conservation, ensures the continuity of life on our property, feeding the pool with crystal clear, potable water.

pool.title: The Spring-Fed Pool
pool.description1: The Lodge's pool is a true reflection of the natural beauty that surrounds us. Fed directly by the spring, the water remains clean and potable, offering our guests a safe and refreshing space to relax.
pool.description2: The natural features of the pool, such as aquariums and lagoons, provide complete immersion in nature, allowing you to enjoy a swim surrounded by the serenity of the forest.

quietEnvironment.title: Quiet Environment
quietEnvironment.description: No sound systems allowed in common areas

waterCare.title: Water Care
waterCare.description: If using cosmetics, sunscreen, or insect repellent, please use the outdoor shower before entering the water

childSupervision.title: Child Supervision
childSupervision.description: Children must be accompanied by parents or guardians

cta.title: Where Nature Meets Comfort
cta.subtitle: Ready to discover our natural spring?

hero.title: Our History
hero.subtitle: A journey of preservation and love for nature

intro.description: Jardim da Amazônia is more than a lodge - it's the story of a family that dedicated their lives to nature preservation and sustainable ecotourism development in Brazil.

1980s.title: The Journey Begins
1980s.description: The story begins with the arrival of the Zanchet family, who came from Rio Grande do Sul to Mato Grosso.

1986.title: Original House Construction
1986.description: The foundation of this house was built from scratch, marking the physical beginning of our presence in this part of the Amazon.

1997.title: Birth of the Lodge
1997.description: At a friend's suggestion, the idea of building a lodge came to life. Raquel Zanchet and Carmelita Zanchet started Jardim da Amazônia Lodge, with the vision of developing Brazilian ecotourism. In the same year, Almor and Carmelita Zanchet invested in a fish farming laboratory and began bird watching activities, marking the beginning of a new era for ecological tourism in the region.

2000.title: Beginning of Birdwatching
2000.description: We started receiving the first groups dedicated to bird watching, establishing the foundations to become a recognized destination for birdwatching in the Amazon.

2008.title: Discovery of the Cone-billed Tanager
2008.description: An important milestone for the region with the recording of the Cone-billed Tanager (Conothraupis mesoleuca), a critically endangered species. This discovery highlights the importance of our area for the conservation of rare species.

home.title: Jardim da Amazônia - Eco Lodge in Southern Amazon
home.description: Experience the unique biodiversity of the Southern Amazon at Jardim da Amazônia. Natural pool, birdwatching, primate observation, and eco-friendly accommodations in Mato Grosso.

acomodacoes.title: Accommodations - Jardim da Amazônia
acomodacoes.description: Discover our comfortable bungalows and apartments, designed to provide a perfect blend of comfort and nature. Experience authentic Amazon hospitality.

areas-externas.title: External Areas - Jardim da Amazônia
areas-externas.description: Explore our external areas including natural pools, gardens, and common spaces. Immerse yourself in the Amazon's natural beauty.

gastronomia.title: Gastronomy - Jardim da Amazônia
gastronomia.description: Savor regional cuisine and fresh ingredients in our restaurant. Experience authentic Amazon flavors and traditional dishes.

birdwatching.title: Birdwatching - Jardim da Amazônia
birdwatching.description: Observe over 590 bird species in their natural habitat. Professional guides and specialized trails for birdwatching enthusiasts.

primatas.title: Primates - Jardim da Amazônia
primatas.description: Observe 7 different primate species in their natural habitat. Expert-guided tours for unique wildlife encounters.

safari-boat.title: Safari Boat - Jardim da Amazônia
safari-boat.description: Experience our river safari along Rio Claro. Observe wildlife and enjoy the Amazon landscape from a unique perspective.

guias-campo.title: Field Guides - Jardim da Amazônia
guias-campo.description: Meet our experienced field guides who will enhance your Amazon experience with their knowledge and expertise.

estacao-pesquisa.title: Research Station - Jardim da Amazônia
estacao-pesquisa.description: Learn about our research station dedicated to Amazon biodiversity studies and conservation efforts.

nascente-natural.title: Natural Spring - Jardim da Amazônia
nascente-natural.description: Discover our crystal-clear natural spring, a unique feature of Jardim da Amazônia offering refreshing waters year-round.

nossaHistoria.title: Our History - Jardim da Amazônia
nossaHistoria.description: Learn about the history and mission of Jardim da Amazônia, our commitment to conservation, and sustainable tourism.

faq.title: FAQ - Jardim da Amazônia
faq.description: Find answers to frequently asked questions about your stay at Jardim da Amazônia. Everything you need to know before your visit.

como-chegar.title: How to Get Here - Jardim da Amazônia
como-chegar.description: Find detailed directions to Jardim da Amazônia from Cuiabá and Sinop airports. Plan your journey to our Amazon paradise.

intro.description: Jardim da Amazônia is committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the best possible experience on our site. This privacy policy explains how we use cookies to improve your browsing experience.

cookies.title: Use of Cookies
cookies.description: The site uses minimal and essential cookies to:

purposes.consent: Store your choice about cookie usage

analytics.title: Collect anonymous analytics, which helps us:
items: Understand how the site is used

cookies.noPersonalData: We do not collect or store any personally identifiable information through cookies.
cookies.control: You can control the use of cookies through your browser settings, but this may limit some site functionalities.

booking.title: Reservations and Accommodation Data
booking.description: All reservations and processing of data related to your stay are handled through the Omnibees system. When clicking to make a reservation, you will be redirected to the Omnibees platform, which has its own privacy policy and terms of use.
booking.recommendation: We recommend that you read Omnibees' privacy policy before proceeding with your reservation:

contact.title: Privacy Contact
contact.description: For questions related to privacy or cookie usage on our site, please contact us through:

updates.title: Policy Updates
updates.description: This policy may be updated periodically. We recommend that you review it regularly to stay informed about how we protect your privacy.
